Katy Sanny was born and lives in the city of Cusco. She is 32 years old and has 2 children. She works in one of the municipalities of Cusco in administration. She has been working for several years and she is doing very well. This time she needs a loan for personal use; specifically for education, food and clothing for her children.

Katy Sanny belongs to the commmunal bank “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” which belongs to the Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity afforded her by the bank and agrees to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for education, food and clothing for her children.

loans.name: Bill

texts.es: Bill tiene 29 años, es un joven emprendedor y muy entusiasta, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a sus tres hermanos menores. El trabajo que realiza Bill es la elaboración de pan de la mejor calidad, para  lo cual cuenta con un espacio en la casa de sus padres, donde tiene los implementos necesarios como un horno moderno rotativo, amasadora y demás utensilios. Ya lleva en esta actividad 2 años, tiempo con el cual ha logrado hacerse de una clientela fiel por el buen sabor de sus panes, además cuenta con el apoyo de un maestro panadero y dos ayudantes para la elaboración de la masa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la idea de poder realizarse como un empresario emprendedor, dar trabajo a otras personas y así ayuda con el desarrollo de su localidad, comenta que tiene otras ideas de negocio como abrir una heladería, pues el clima de la región es favorable. Este sería su primer crédito con MFP, se siente contento con el apoyo y los ánimos que viene recibiendo por parte de los miembros de su grupo comunal, y se compromete en ser puntual con sus pagos para así poder acceder a nuevos créditos de mayor cantidad. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará insumos para la panificación como: harina por saco, mantequilla, azúcar, así podrá disminuir costos y mejorar sus márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en: Bill is 29 years old. He is a very enthusiastic young entrepreneur. He is single with no children, and he lives in his parents' house together with his three younger siblings. Bill's work is preparing bread of the best quality. To do this, he has a space in his parents' house where he maintains the necessary equipment, such as a modern convection oven, a kneading machine and other tools. He has done this work for 2 years, and during this time he has been able to build up a loyal customer base, thanks to the good taste of his bread. He also has the support of a master baker as well as two assistants to prepare the dough. What he likes about his work is the idea of being able to achieve his dreams as a hard-working entrepreneur, provide jobs for other people, and thus help with the development of his town. He comments that he has other business ideas such as opening an ice cream shop, since the climate of the area is favorable for this. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he is happy with the support and the inspiration he has been receiving from the other members of his communal bank. He is committed to being punctual with his payments, so he can have access to new loans of greater quantity. With the funds he is requesting, he will buy supplies for breadmaking such as flour by the sack, butter, and sugar, so that he can reduce his costs and improve his profit margins.

loans.use: to buy flour by the sack, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Eliana; La socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 21, 19, 7 años de edad, la socia se dedica  a la preparación del tradicional plato peruano el ceviche, la socia elabora el ceviche a base de pescado, ella mezcla diversos ingredientes como cebollas, limón, ajo, canchitas, camote, rocoto y otros ingredientes, la socia tiene su stand y ya es muy conocida en el centro comercial en el cual ella trabaja, la socia en esta oportunidad desea invertir el crédito en la compra de ingredientes como arroz para acompañar el palto con arroz chaufa y ceviche, la socia comprara dos sacos de arroz, pescado, sal al por mayor y otros productos menores que le dejan sus caseros en dos partes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de arroz dos sacos grandes, sal un saco y el pago del pescado que le traen a la socia en avioneta.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the ”IMASUMAC II” communal bank. This communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Her name is Eliana, and she is 40 years old. She is single and has 3 children, aged 21, 19, and 7. Her work is preparing the traditional Peruvian dish ceviche. She prepares her ceviche using fish, and she mixes in various ingredients such as onions, lime, garlic, canchitas [corn kernels], sweet potato, rocoto peppers, and other ingredients. She has her own stand, and she is very well-known in the shopping center where she works. On this occasion, the borrower wants to invest in buying ingredients such as rice to prepare plates of avocado with fried rice and ceviche. She will buy two sacks of rice, fish, and salt on a wholesale basis, and she will also buy some retail products that her suppliers will give her in two parts. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in buying two large sacks of rice, one sack of salt, and paying for the fish which is brought in to her by small airplane. 

The borrower is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying two large sacks of rice, one sack of salt, and fish flown in by small plane, among other supplies.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yenny; La socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 13, 8, 8 meses de edad, la socia se dedica  a la atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia tiene su negocio en su misma vivienda y ella puede alternar los trabajos del hogar con la administración de su tienda de abarrotes ella acomodo todo su comedor y cocina para dar paso a su negocio propio, la socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, al por mayor, azúcar, harinas, sal, fideos, aceite, leche por cajas, y otros productos, para implementar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yenny belongs to the Imasumac II communal bank.  The bank is in the Huanchac district of the Cusco province and department.  Yenny, age 30, is married and has three children.  The children are 13, 8, and 8 months.  

Yenny manages her grocery store.  She has her business in her house.  She is able to alternate her household chores with managing her grocery store.  She has arranged all of her dining room and kitchen to make space for her own business.

Yenny now needs a loan to buy basic needs items wholesale like rice, sugar, flour, salt, noodles, oil, cases of milk, and other products for her grocery store.  She is requesting the loan to buy basic needs items.  

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: La señora Leonor es una mujer que ha estado firme a pesar de la situación que paso hace unos años cuando falleció su esposo por lo que tuvo que salir adelante para poder sostener sus gastos. Desde que su esposo ya no esta con ella no hubo quien le diera mantenimiento a su hogar, puesto que las paredes y techo de su casa comenzaron a cuartearse cada día mas y por consecuencia se trasmina el agua en temporada de lluvia. Para arreglar las paredes y techo que están en muy malas condiciones necesita comprar cemento, yeso, pintura y pagar mano de obra, de esta manera podrá vivir tranquilamente ya que este problema puede hacer que su casa se destruya.
texts.en: Sra. Leonora is a woman who tackles her problems straight on.  When her husband died a few years ago, she found a way to support herself.  Without him around to take care of the house, though, cracks opened up in the wall and ceiling, growing little by little until the rain poured through.  Sra. Leonora wants to borrow money now to pay for cement, plaster, paint and workmen to fix the problem.  She wants to be confident that the problem doesn't end with her house falling down.

loans.use: to pay for cement, sand and labor.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Maria has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El señor Manuel estudio hace años para Maestro de educación primaria en cual duro mas de 30 años ofreciendo su servicio a impartir clases a alumnos de 1 año hasta 6 años, hace poco por su larga trayectoria lo pensionaron. La casa donde actualmente vive actualmente la compro con ahorros y que poco a poco le ha estado realizando variedad de mejoras para que viva cómodamente su familia. En este momento quiere el préstamo para colocar vitromuro en las paredes del baño para darle un aspecto higiénico y bonito. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar vitromuro, pegamento y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Manuel holds a Master's degree in primary education and worked as a teacher, giving classes to students from 1 to 6 years old, for over 30 years. After a long career, he recently retired. He bought his current house with his savings and has been improving it little by little in order to make it more comfortable for his family. He would like a loan in order to tile the walls of the bathroom, to make it look more hygienic and attractive. For this project he needs to buy tile, grout and pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to fix his bathroom.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 51 años de edad y es casado fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Porfirio vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Porfirio trabaja en construcción civil y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en venta de productos de primera necesidad. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Porfirio requiere el préstamo para compra mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más. 

El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Porfirio was born in the city of Cusco (in Peru) and is 51 years old. He is married and has two children. Today, Porfirio lives in the same town where he was born. Porfirio works in civil construction and has a family business that sells foodstuffs. It's been two years already that he's been working in this business, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. 

At this time, Porfirio is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar and much more. The member is a responsible and hard-working man, and it is for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to join the "Chaska Nawi" community bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, for example rice, sugar, and much more.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
El señor  Silverio conviviente más de 8 años con la señora Ninfa , ambos con  una instrucción de nivel primaria, tienen 3 hijos dependientes, la familia radica en la comunidad de Duraznos Pampa hacia el norte de Colomi hace 8 años atrás.
El señor Silverio y su esposa son agricultores anualmente venden papa y locoto en la feria semanal de Colomi, como también cuentan con un vehículo que lo utilizan para el traslado a su fuente laboral, motivo ellos quieren mejorar la producción agrícola y necesitan un crédito, se tuvo la iniciativa de pasar por la zona para otorgarle el préstamo que necesitaban el sr. Silverio y la sra. Ninfa.
texts.en:
Silverio has lived for more than 8 years with his partner, Ninfa, and they have 3 children together. Both Silverio and Ninfa have a grade school education. They have lived in the Duraznos Pampa community, north of Colomi, for 8 years. 

Silverio and his wife are farmers. They sell potatoes and peppers at the weekly market in Colomi. Since they have a vehicle that they can use to transport their merchandise, they would like to increase their agricultural production. That is why they are requesting a loan to buy additional supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his agricultural work.

loans.name: Isalita

texts.en:
Isalita is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 
Isalita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Isalita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Medelita

texts.en:
Medelita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Medelita has a shop where she sells different varieties of dried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of dried fish to sell.
Medelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Medelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Brenda Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Brenda Aracely es una mujer muy emprendedora que les gusta el negocio por tal motivo pensó en poner venta de ropa usada  en una de las colonias de la ciudad, el cual se podría desarrollar como una buena negociante. Con el negocio ya tiene 3 años ofreciendo a su clientela una buena atención, un mejor servicio y variedad de estilos de ropa. Desde que comenzó su negocio comenzó a dar resultados por lo que siguió adelante ya que seria la forma de tener un ingreso extra aparte del que percibía por su esposo que trabaja como jefe de maquinas en una maquiladora de la ciudad.
Brenda necesita comprar ropa de temporada de invierno, por que en este momento ya sus clientes le están solicitando y ve que es una buena oportunidad de tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Brenda Aracely is a very enterprising woman who likes business. For this reason she thought of selling used clothing in one of the districts of the city. This would cause her to develop into a good businesswoman. She's had the business for three years already, offering her customers attentiveness, better service, and a variety of styles of clothing. Ever since she started her business it began to pay off, and so she went ahead with it since it would be a way to have extra income--apart from what her husband earns as chief engineer at an assembly plant in the city. Brenda needs to buy winter clothing because her customers are already asking for it now and she sees that it's a good opportunity to have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated. 
Severina has a shop where she sells snacks, canned goods and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Severina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Severina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 63 años, es una mujer alegre y entusiasta, casada vive con su esposo, sus dos hijos mayores y dos nietos menores D. edad, vive en su casa propia la cual compró con el apoyo D. su esposo. Rosa D. dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su bodega, negocio que lo tiene instalado en su propia casa, y ahora es muy concurrida por los vecinos. A todos atienD. con amabilidad,  su bodega lleva ya 4 años D. funcionamiento, tiempo en cual ha llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando además con el apoyo D. su esposo para la atención al publico. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona y poder apoyar dándole la facilidad a sus vecinos D. poder adquirir sus productos D. primera necesidad cerca a sus casas y no tener que realizar largos tramos para poder adquirir estos productos. Tiene muchas ganas D. seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar  su negocio. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo D. cada uno D. ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos variados al por mayor para surtir su bodega, ya que así podrá tener mayor margen D. ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 63 years old. She is a happy and enthusiastic woman who is married and lives with her husband, her 2 adult children, and 2 young grandchildren.  She lives in her own home, which she bought with her husband.  Rosa has a grocery store that she set up in her own home.  The business is now very popular with the neighbors.  She attends to everyone with friendliness, and her store has been in business for 4 years.  Over time, the store has become very well known and busy, and she also counts on the help of her husband to serve the public.  What she likes about her work is that it has maD. her well known in the area, and she is able to help out her neighbors by giving them credit so that they can buy their necessities near their home.  This way, they don't have to travel long distances to be able to acquire the products they need.  She has a strong desire to continue to grow in her line of work and expand her business.  This will be her third loan with MFP, and so she awaits the support of each one of you.  With the sum requested, she will buy a variety of products at wholesale to stock her store, since in this way she will have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy grocery products at wholesale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es casado con la señora Gabriela  hace 16 años, tienen 4 hijos dependientes que están estudiando en nivel primario y secundario, viven más de 32 años en la comunidad de Cayarani hacia el norte de Colomi.
El señor Francisco V. tuvo la oportunidad de solicitar un préstamo para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) ya que a otras entidades le quedo muy lejos y le pidieron muchos requisitos.
El señor Francisco y su esposa se sienten felices por haber conseguido el dinero que más necesitaban, ahora sembrara lo más antes ya que tenía guardado semilla de papa y le estaba faltando fertilizante orgánico, también nos dice para el año que viene tendrá mejores condiciones de vida siempre apoyando en su estudio de su hijos y que salgan profesionales para que tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Francisco has been married to Gabriela for 16 years and they have 4 children who are studying in primary and secondary school. They have lived in the Cayarani community, north of Colomi, for more than 32 years. Francisco has requested a loan in order to buy organic fertilizer. He and his wife are very happy to have received the money that they needed and they will plant more crops than before. They had stored potato seeds instead of planting them because they didn't have organic fertilizer. This will help improve the quality of their lives in the coming year and support the studies of their children so they can become professionals and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Purcita

texts.en:
Purcita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 
Purcita has a seafood shop where she sells products like squid and octopus. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more seafood like squid and octopus to sell.
Purcita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Purcita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seafood products like squid and octopus.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, es una persona bien conocida y trabajadora por su zona, es soltero y no tiene hijos, es un hermano ejemplar, su madre y el educan a sus 4 hermanos, el se dedica al cultivo de platano de freir en la localidad de mariposas, su mercado es netamente local y su competencia es muy creciente, actualmente sus ingresos le sirven para poder  sobrevivir, su madre es una persona mayor por lo cual no puede trabajar por lo consiguiente el es el único sustento de su familia, 
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de Plantines de piña, para contar con una variedad de productos y así poder generar un mas ingresos y mejorar la vida que tiene el y su familia
texts.en:
Juan is well known in his community and his a very hard worker. He is single and does not have any children but he is an exemplary brother. He and his mother care for his 4 brothers. He grows plantains, his customer base is extremely local and his competition is growing. Juan's current incomes supports his family and allows them to survive, since his mother is older and unable to work. 

This is the first time Juan has requested a loan, which he will use to buy pineapple plants in order to diversify his products. In this way he hopes to increase his income so that he can improve his family's life.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Crisanta provides transportation, or habal-habal, services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools and gasoline.
Crisanta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Crisanta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Ester has a shop where she sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more fish to sell.
Ester has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ester hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married with children. She is 53 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin Misamis Occidental.
Narcisa raises pigs for sale to earn a living. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional pigs to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Narcisa hopes to expand and improve her business to support their daily needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Pacita has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Pacita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Pacita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Marivic buys and sells clothing, towels and bed sheets. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of clothing and towels to sell.
Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing and towels for sale.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La señora Flora, tiene 40 años es madre de tres hijos en edades escolares, su esposo trabaja en su propio taller de tornería, su vivienda y pequeña granja están ubicadas  en la maica chica a tres kilómetros de la ciudad está mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su granja, necesita capital de inversión para comprar cáscara de soya para sus vacas asimismo está terminando unos comederos para su ganado.
texts.en: Sra. Flora, 40, is the mother of three school-aged children.  Her husband works in the machine shop that he owns.  Her house and farm are in La Maica Chica, some three kilometers from the city.  To improve her standard of living, she is looking for investment capital that she will use to make improvements to her farm.  She plans to buy feed troughs and cattle feed.

loans.use: to buy feed and feed troughs for cattle business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn  is married. She has four children. Marilyn  is 45 years old and she  lives in Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental.

Marilyn sells candies, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and corn grits,can goods and other to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional goods to sell for her store. Marilyn has been a member of GDMPC this year only. In the future, Marilyn striving hard for the education of her children because she has two daughter now in college and she want to continue renovate her house. She is hoping that her business will give return doubled.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell for her store

loans.name: Cayo

texts.es: EL SEÑOR CAYO , es una persona de 32 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, y cuenta con tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica del cliente y su esposa es netamente la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva y comercializa son la papa y haba en estado verde; la siembra de estos cultivos los realiza aproximadamente en una superficie cultivable de 2.5 Has. en sus propias parcelas heredadas de sus padres que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Huaylla Pujru del municipio de Tíraque que esta distante a unos 74 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. El señor Cayo y su esposa manifiestan ser personas trabajadores y responsables que quieren superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa y de tal forma poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Sr. Cayo, 32, and his wife have three children.  He has a primary school education.  He's a farmer and his main crops are potatoes and green beans.  The farm covers a cultivable area of 2.5 hectares (or a little more than 6 acres).  He inherited the farm from his parents.  The farm is in Huaylla Pujru, a rural community in Tiraque, some 74 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  Sr. Cayo and his wife are hard-working and responsible people who want to improve their standard of living.  To do so, they plan to increase their output, a plan for which they need investment capital to buy chicken manure (for fertilizing the land) and seeds for their next potato crop. The investment will allow Sr. Cayo to improve the quality of life of all those who depend on him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rose is making and peddling snacks like banana cakes, banana cues and pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married. She has two children. Jocelyn is 34 years old and she lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Jocelyn sells soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and spices to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 6,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional stock for her store. Jocelyn has  been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jocelyn hope to improve  her business so that she can support her two children by sending them to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock from Natasha and Avon.

loans.name: Ledie Claire

texts.en:
Ledie Claire is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Ledie Claire has a food shop where she sells barbecue and hotdog kebabs. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for her business.
Ledie Claire has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ledie Claire hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for barbecue and hotdog sales.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La  Señora Juana tiene 38 años, casado con el Sr. Juan Vallejos Alvarado cuentan 2 hijos menores dependientes , viven en la comunidad de San Isidro a 36 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la señora Juana realiza colchones de paja en la misma comunidad, es una persona humilde trabajadora,  necesita dinero para pagar del anticrético de un cuarto de su hijo que esta estudiando en Sacaba, Para ella es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos, CIDRE IFD presta servicios en la zona y oferta créditos, la Sra. Juana Rodríguez esta muy contento de haber conseguido un préstamo de nuestra Institución ahora va pagar del anticrético de un cuarto y ya no pagara alquiler y poder ahorrar dinero para hacer estudiar a sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Juana, 38, and her husband, Sr. Juan Vallejos Alvarado, have 2 young children.  They live in the town of San Isidro, some 36 kilometers from Cochabamba.  Sra. Juana makes straw mattresses for a living.  She's applying for a loan to pay for an "anticretico" arrangement (a pre-paid rental contract common in Bolivia) for her son who is going to school in Sacaba.  She can't borrow from banks in the city because they have many requirements that she can't easily meet.  CIDRE IFD provides loans in the area.  Sra. Juana is very happy with our Institution's lending arrangements because she can save the money that she would have had to pay in rent by paying for the room "anticretico" now.  She can use the money she will save over the term of the "anticretico" to pay for her children's educations.

loans.use: to pay for a room for her son who is studying in another town.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is married with seven children. She is 71 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis, Occidental.
Inocencia sells soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and spices to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she   earns PHP 3,980. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional stock for her store. 
Inocencia has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future Inocencia hopes to improve her business so that she can support her grandchildren by sending them to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is married with eleven children. She is 60 years old and lives in Calabayan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. Trinidad sells various kinds of banana to earn a living and has had this business for nine years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase fertilizer for her farm. Trinidad has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future Trinidad hopes to improve her business so that she can give  moral support to her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El Sr. Tomas tiene 30 años de edad conviviente con la Sra. Bertha hace 15 años tienen
4 hijos viven en la comunidad de Iluri Grande a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el sr. Tomas y su
esposa son agricultores producen papa, haba, arveja en su parcela de terreno de Has 2 con rotación de
cultivo para ampliar el cultivo en mayor extensión necesita mas capital, los ahorros que tenia invertido
en la compra de un lote de terreno para vivienda para ellos acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad es muy
lejos además le piden muchos requisitos. El sr.Tomas esta muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito para aumentar sus ingresos económicos asi tendrá ahorro para construir su vivienda en el área urbana, para que sus hijos estudian en Colomi.
texts.en:
Tomas is 30 years old and has been living together with Bertha for 15 years and they have 4 children. They live in the community of Iluri Grande some 42 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.
 
Tomas and his wife are farmers growing potatoes, beans, and peas in their two hectares of land and in order to expand the rotation of their crops they need more capital. They have invested their savings that they had into the purchase of a piece of land for housing.

The city banks are far away and they have many requirements. Tomas is very happy to have been given a loan in order to increase his income so he will have savings in order to build his house in the urban area in order for his children to go to school in Colomi.

loans.use: to put capital from the loan into his agricultural activities

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Yolanda has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Yolanda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA Alicia, es una persona de 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive actualmente con su madre que es una persona de la tercera edad y cuenta con un solo dependiente económico la cual es su hija. La actividad económica de la cliente es la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva  son la papa, trigo y cebada en sus terrenos propios y en las de su madre que están ubicadas en la comunidad de Cebada Jichana del municipio de Tíraque que esta distante a unos 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Alicia manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa y de tal forma poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dependientes
texts.en: Alicia is a 27 year old person who is single. She has a primary school education and lives with her mother, who is elderly. She has one financial dependent, which is her daughter. This client's economic activity is agriculture and the main products she grows are potatoes, wheat and barley. She plants on her own land and on her mother's, located in the community of Cebada Jichana in the town of Tíraque, which is 65 Km from the city of  Cochabamba. Alicia has shown herself to be a hardworking and responsible person who wants to get ahead and increase her agricultural production. For that she needs to ask for investment capital to buy chicken manure fertilizer and potato seed. In this way, she will improve her and her dependents quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken manure fertilizer and potato seed.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 31 años, es una mujer luchadora con ganas de ser una gran empresaria, es madre soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de sus cuatro hermanos, su pequeña hija a quien adora y se esfuerza por darle lo mejor y que no le falte nada en esta vida. El trabajo de Patricia consiste en la elaboración y venta de productos lácteos como queso, yogurt, para lo cual cría vacas en el terreno de sus padres. Dedicada 10 años a esta actividad, le han servido para  ganar experiencia en su rubro, dedicándose íntegramente y contando con el apoyo de sus hermanos y asu vez contrata peones de la zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso para poder mantener la economía de su casa, trabajando arduamente y sacar adelante a su hija y hermanos. Viendo que  tiene mucha  demanda los productos pues tiene pedidos pendiente por atender, espera poder seguir creciendo y agradece la oportunidad brindada en el otorgamiento de su préstamo solicitado. Este será el quinto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda  y conforme con el grupo que conforma, siente que son personas responsables y ella también se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos para poder seguir contando con el apoyo de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprar frutas y envases para la elaboración de yogurt así como alambres para su cerco donde cría sus vacas.
texts.en: 31 year old Patricia is a hardworking woman who aims to be successful businesswoman. She is a single mother and lives with her parents, her four brothers, and her young daughter who she adores. Patricia strives to give her daughter the best and to make sure she is lacking for nothing. Patricia makes and sells dairy products such as cheese and yoghurt, and for this she raises cows on her parents' land. She has dedicated 10 years to this business and has gained a lot of experience in this sector. She has devoted herself to the work and has had the support of her brothers and has hired local laborers. What she likes about the work is that it enables her to have an income with which to support the household while she works hard and brings up her daughter and brothers. Being as there is considerable demand for her products and she has pending orders to attend to, she hopes to continue growing and is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by having this loan granted. This will be her 5th loan from the institution MFP, and she feels comfortable with the group she is a member of. She thinks they are responsible people and she also promises to be punctual with her repayments so that she can continue to have your support. She will use the sum of money requested to buy fruit and containers for making yoghurt and also wire fence for the yard where she raises her cows.

loans.use: to buy fruits, containers, and wire to secure her cowshed.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Wilma has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

Wilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Marissa has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of dried fish to sell.

Marissa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en: Bryan is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with two children. Bryan is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Bryan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bryan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, alegre y muy dinámica, esta casada, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, sus padres y sus dos hijos, quienes estudian en la universidad para forjarse un futuro mejor. El trabajo que realiza Anita es el alquiler de cabinas de internet, donde tiene seis computadoras bien instaladas y siendo muy concurrido ya que es la única por la zona. Su negocio está instalado en un local acondicionado en su propia casa, el cual viene funcionando desde hace seis años, tiempo que le ha valido para hacerse muy conocida. Asimsmo cuenta con el apoyo de un ayudante que contrata por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas le apoya su hija. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener ingreso económico regular para el sostén de la economía familiar y poder pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijos, que la llena de orgullo es que tiene gran demanda del servicio que ofrece, por ello desea poder ampliar y crecer su negocio. Este sería el crédito número con MFP, y se siente muy contenta por el grupo al cual está integrada,  pues considera que son personas puntuales y eso le grandes ánimos de seguir trabajando. Con el dinero solicitado, comprará teclados de computadoras, mouse, cables de internet y demás accesorios para las computadoras, pues nos comenta que por el uso continuo los actuales ya están malográndose.
texts.en:
44 year old Anita is a hardworking woman, cheerful, and very dynamic. She is married and lives in her own house with her husband, her parents, and their two children who are studying at the university so that they can forge themselves a better future. 
Anita runs an internet cafe and has 6 well set-up computers and she is very busy because hers is the only intent cafe in the area. Her business is run from an air-conditioned unit in her own house, and she has had the business for 6 years and has become very well known in this time. She is supported by one helper who works during the afternoons, and her daughter helps her in the mornings. What she likes about her business is that is enables her to have a regular income to support her family and to pay for her children's education. It fills her with pride that there is so much demand for the service she offers, so she wants to grow and extend her business. She is very content with the loan group that she is a member of and thinks they are punctual people and this gives her great encouragement to keep working. She will use the requested loan to buy computer keyboards, mice, internet cables, and other computer accessories because the continuous use is wearing out the current accessories.

loans.use: to buy keyboards, mice, internet cables, and other PC accessories.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children.
 
Emelyn has a shop where she sells wood & coco charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy raw materials needed to make charcoal.

Emelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making charcoal

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with two children. Rosita is 56 years old and lives in Nailon Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Rosita owns and manage a restaurant to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional food ingredients for her restaurant and other restaurant equipment. 

Rosita has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve and expand her business so that they can fulfill the dreams of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional food ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some piglets for raising.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a poultry house and sells grown chickens. She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy chicken feed for the chickens. Elvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is married and has 7 children. He is 58 years of age, and he lives in Canibungan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He raises bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 8,500 doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for his farm. Eugenio has  been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future he hopes to improve his business so that he can give a brighter future to his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Melanio

texts.en: Melanio is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. He has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melanio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melanio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Ester has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ester has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is widow with 3 children. She is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Arlene owns store to earn a living and she has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to have additional capital for her store. Arlene has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year.  In the future, she hopes to improve her small business so that she can build her own house.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her store.

loans.name: Jernalyn

texts.en: Jernalyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Jernalyn buys and sells grown pigs and goats. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs and goats. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs and goats.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Adelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of firewood to sell. Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children.

Perla is providing motorela or habal-habal services. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Perla has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.

Dorotea has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Dorotea has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Dorotea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Pamela

texts.en:
Maria is married with 4 children. Maria is 40 years of age and she lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Maria owns and manages a shop to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month she earns 20,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 26,385 PHP to purchase additional materials for her shop.

Maria has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Maria hopes to build another shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her shop

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a widow with 7 children. Pacita is 66 years old and lives in Purok 6 Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Pacita sells copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month she earns 3,425 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP use to renovates her copra dryer behind her. The copra here in the Philippines is dried by putting it in the "landahan" and have fire in the bottom. Behind Pacita that is locally called "landahan" or dryer

Pacita has been a member of GDMPC for 7 years.  Pacita do her very best to improve her business and save portion of her profit because she wants to have electricity in her home.

loans.use: to renovate of her copra dryer

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is 46 years old, married, and has operated his restaurant for almost 20 years. Early in the morning, he cooks and prepares daily meals to sell in his restaurant. He operates his food stall at the nearby school cooking suitable meals for the students. In this kind of business, he usually generates an income of about P20,000 each month. The profits earned go for school fees for his two children. Other parts of the income are used as revolving capital for the business and enable him to continuously operate the business.

He is now requesting an additional capital of P30,000 to buy pork meat, vegetables, sugars, cooking oil, onions and garlic as ingredients in cooking meals to sell in his restaurant.

Jeffrey would like to prepare more food to sell and keep making better sales to save enough money for the education of his children. He wants to continuously provide a good education for them so that someday they will find good employment.

loans.use: to buy pork meat, vegetables, sugars, cooking oil, onions and garlic as ingredients in cooking meals to sell.

loans.name: Russel Ann

texts.en: Rusell Ann is married but has no child. She is 31 years old and she is located in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 10,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks for her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Rusell Ann hopes to improve her sari sari store so that she can support the daily needs of her sisters and brothers.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her store.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun, 52, lives in a common law relationship and has five children. She is a local farmer from Kompong Chhnang province. She tills a parcel of land for growing rice crops. She makes an annual profit from her business. Mrs. Oeun plans to expand into additional farmland for more income. However, she does not have sufficient capital to achieve her purpose. She said, “I’ll be able to generate the rice production at a high rate with my experience, and then I can keep it for daily food as well as sell it for money.”

Mrs. Oeun has applied for a loan from Kiva through HKL to buy extra farmland and mineral fertilizers to provide crop maintenance to her rice crops. The loan will be of much help for her to be able to invest in her rice crops.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ernel

texts.en:
Due to the lack of job opportunities, Ernel is engaged in a rice farming business to earn income and support his family's needs. He is now 35 years old and has two school-age children. As a responsible father, he aims to uplift their status of living and give the children a bright future. In this regard, he endures hardships and difficulties, for he wants to increase his income to satisfy their basic needs and to finance the education of the children. 

Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of P35,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of his rice farming business. He believes that through his patience and hard work, he will increase his yields and income this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farming business.

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ullyses

texts.en:
Ullyses is single but has 1 child. He is 29 years old and he lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He has a small motor repair shop to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 6,000 doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional materials for his shop. He has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future, he hopes for success in his small business so that he can support the education of his only daughter.

loans.use: to purchase additional material for his shop.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Rosemarie helps her husband in planting root crops (taro) in their village to generate additional income. She is 43 years old and has four school-age children. They aim to continue sending their children to school for they want them to earn a degree and becomes professionals in the future. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to increase their income to acquire their needs and finance the education of their children. 

In this regard, Rosemarie is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizers for the maintenance of their root crop production. She hopes that through this loan, they will increase their production and their income and satisfy their family needs.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for the maintenance of their root crop production.

loans.name: Wilbeth

texts.en:
Wilbeth is a hardworking mother. She devotes herself to selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She has been in this business for almost two years. She usually earns about P2,000 each month. She is a single parent. She needs to generate income to save for the education of her child. 

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and fish to sell in her stall. This will help increase the number of sales from her business and thus boost up her profits.

In the future, she would like to keep making better sales and achieve financial stability to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Fortunineza

texts.en: Fortunineza is single. She is 22 years of age and she located at Barangay Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells snacks in the community to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to use as additional capital for her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Fortunineza hopes to build her own store.

loans.use: to use as additional capital for her store.

loans.name: Arnelyn

texts.en: Arnelyn is married with 1 child. She is 26 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, candies and noodles to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional stock for her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, Arnelyn hopes to improve her business so that she can have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
At the age of 19, Apollo got married. He did not have the chance to enter college because his parents had no capacity to send him to school. At that time, Apollo was helping his parents in doing activities in farming. He also helped his parents in managing their small livestock business. He was also not given a chance to work because his education level is low. He learned from his family how to manage a hog raising business.

Now, Apollo is 41 years old. He is happy living with his wife and four children. When his wife went abroad, Apollo determined to start up a hog raising business. He is happy that his business has been running for almost 11 years up to the present. His hog raising business serves as a source of income for him, and his profits mostly went to his children's allowances in school and to household expenses.

Apollo wants to develop his business, so he is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to maintain the business and develop through the loan he requested. It will also be a big help for him to maintain his source of income and further bestow his family's necessities.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: March

texts.en: March is 35 years old, and works in a shoe factory where she earns $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $2.5 per day. They have one child who is 10 years old and in school. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on house rent, $2 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. She wants to buy a cow to feed, and get its baby to sell when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Sokheng is a garment factory worker earning $2 per day. Her husband has a small shop to do electronic repairs from which he earns $6 per day. They have two children, one is studying and the other is too young to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $6 on electricity, $20 on house rent, $3 on school fees, and $7 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy equipment for electrical repairs to help her husband’s career. This loan will help her husband to have enough equipment that can provide better service to his customers. The couple plans to extend their shop and wants to open an electric repairing school so that they can make other income.

loans.use: To buy equipment for electrical repairs to help her husband's career.

loans.name: Sophart

texts.en: Sophart is 53 years old and a farmer.  He sells animals and earns $10 per day. His wife is a farmer, and sells fish earning $10 per day. They have three children; one is studying, and the other two are working earning $10 per day each. Every month, he has to spend $61 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy cow for farming and to sell. He doesn't want to change his career of selling cows because he can make good income from this career.

loans.use: To buy cow for farming and to sell

loans.name: On

texts.en:
On, pictured in the photo, and her husband, Bunthoeun, are farmers. When she is not at the farm, she also buys nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks and resells them in her village. 

The couple has been married for almost ten years, and has four children; three sons and one daughter. Three are in school, and the other one is still young. They live in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

On hopes to continue her business, so she decided to apply for another loan in the mount of $1,000 to buy addition nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks for sale.

loans.name: Siby

texts.en: Siby is 42 years old and is a grocery seller earning $7 per day. Her husband buys and sells fruit earning $3 per day. They have four children, one is studying and the rest are helping their mother sell grocery goods. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $3 on electricity, $4 on school fees, $3 on transportation, and $7 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy fruit to sell. She wants to extend her husband’s business so  he can make good profit from his business.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Sam Ang (in the photo) is 51-years-old and her husband, Sras, is 50 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1980 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is an electrician, another one is garment worker and another one attends school.  

Sam Ang and her husband raise fish at home. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to help wither her fish farming business by buying fish feed.

loans.use: to buy fish feed.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 41-years-old, is a housewife. Her husband is a worker and earns $4 per day. They have four children; three are working and each earns $3 per day and one more is only one-year-old. 

Every month she has to spend $78 on food, and $10 on other expense. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy yams to sell. 

Before, her husband used to hire workers to plant a bean plantation but he lost his crop because of too much rain. Now he does not plant but instead buys the vegetables or fruits to sell because it is not as high risk and he can make a better income.

loans.use: to buy yams to sell.

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (pictured here), and her husband, Thuok, have been married since 1994 and have two daughters who are in school. The family lives on an island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhan now sells pickled fruit in her village. Her husband is a farmer who grows vegetable. He hopes to continue his vegetable farming. Thus, Sokhan is applying for another loan of $200 to support her husband’s work by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to help supply her husband with the capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 59, married and has four adult children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to supplement her husband's income. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, they aim to uplift their status of living and give their children a better future. She aims to strengthen her variety store to earn a higher income and satisfy their necessities. 

To improve the business, she is asking for an additional capital of P7,000 to buy soft drinks, junk foods, breads, beverages, noodles and seasonings to sell. She hopes that this loan will help a lot to improve her variety store. She hopes that in the future, she will make the business grow and profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, junk foods, breads, beverages, noodles and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng (in the photo) is a weaver. She is a widow with seven children - three sons and four daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, two are house constructors, one is a horse cart driver and another one is in school.  The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Seng is asking for a loan of $500 to help with her son who is a horse cart driver by buying one more horse.

loans.use: to help with her son’s business of driving a horse cart by purchasing one more horse.

loans.name: Chhun Eng

texts.en:
Chhun Eng and her husband, Sokun, are silk weavers. They have been married since 1990, and they have three children -- one son and two daughters.  One child is a weaver; another one is in school; and another one is still young. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City in Cambodia.

Chhun Eng is requesting another loan of $300 to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials.

Photo: Chhun Eng is not pictured with her loom because under her the area is flooded. She needs to move her looms to her mother’s house, the same location where she lives, because that location is not affected by the flood.

loans.use: to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun, 38 years old, is a farmer and pig seller. She earns $1.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $4 per day. They have four children; two are studying and two more work in a garment factory. Each earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent/a house fee, $8 on school fees, $13 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy pigs to feed and sell. The rest of the money she will keep for her daughter's wedding. She wants to feed more pigs so she can make a good profit at this time.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 29 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $5 per day. Her husband also works in the factory, earning $6 per day. They have two children; one is studying and one more is too small for school. Every month, she has to spend $42 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on rent/a house fee, $5 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $7 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her and her husband, who travels to work in Phnom Penh City. In the future, she wants to sell grocery goods at home. Her husband has a motor taxi service so that they can stay home together.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her and her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married and has three children. Elma is 37 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. Elma sells rice and corn to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

Elma has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future, Elma hopes to improve and expand her business so she can support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Basilides

texts.en:
Basilides is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Basilides has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Basilides has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Basilides hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Koemphal

texts.en:
Koemphal (pictured in the photo) is a 40-year-old tailor. Her husband, Noeurn, is a 39-year-old construction worker. They live in a village along National Road number five, which is approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1986, and they have three children: two sons and one daughter. One child is a garment worker, one is a driver, and another is in school.

Koemphal wants to start a new business of raising chickens, so she is asking for her first loan of $500 to buy baby chickens to raise as well as chicken feed.

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Gnet

texts.en:
Gnet, 34 years old, is a Khmer noodle seller. She explains that she typically earns $6 per day. Her husband is a soldier, and he typically earns $1.50 per day. They have two children, both of whom are in school. Every month she spends approximately $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $17 on other expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a machine to make Khmer noodles for re-sale purposes. This loan would enable her make more Khmer noodles to sell to her customers. She plans to expand her business so that she can have additional customers.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to make Khmer noodles.

loans.name: Vary

texts.en:
Vary (pictured in the photo), 45 years old, sells fish in Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Sarat, is a 47-year-old rice and lotus farmer. They live in a village along National Road number five, which is approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990, and they have five children: four sons and one daughter. Three of their children are garment workers, one attends school, and another is still too young for school.

Vary is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to assist with her husband’s farming business. Specifically, she would like to buy a motorized hand tiller.

loans.use: To assist with her husband’s farming business by purchasing a motorized tiller.

loans.name: Sheralyn

texts.en:
Sheralyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Sheralyn buys and sells fruits, such as mangoes and durian, with the help of her husband (pictured) as the motorcycle driver. She has been running this business for 5 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy more fruit to deliver and sell. Sheralyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Sheralyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruit for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, 59 years old, is a grocery seller earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a farmer earning approximately $1 per day. They have three children, all of whom are working and earning approximately $3 per day. Every month she spends approximately $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to buy a motorbike for her children so that they can more easily travel to work. She does not want to change her business because she can earn solid profits from it.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to travel to work

loans.name: Jenelry

texts.en:
Jenelry is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Jenelry has vegetable garden and harvests and sells vegetables like eggplants and string beans. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.
Jenelry has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jenelry hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Halimaan's Group

texts.en: Halimaan is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. She couldn’t provide education to all of them due to poor financial conditions. She is very skillful and makes Pranaday, which is a very popular product among women, used to tie up hair. Her husband makes mud utensils. He has great artful hands and makes beautiful looking utensils which he sells to different shops for profits.  Four of her children also work. They do different kinds of businesses to financially contribute to the family. Halimaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her Pranaday making business. With the loan, she will buy thread and beads in larger quantities to make Paranday of different kinds (simple and beaded). She has been operating her business for many years, and is very confident that an investment will help her improve her sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy thread and beads for Paranday making business.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Joey has a shop that buys and sells fruits like durian. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy stocks of fruits to sell.
Joey has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Joey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Samnag

texts.en:
Samnang (pictured here) is a mason, and lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, across the Mekong River. He has been married since 1990 and has five children- four sons and one daughter. One is a security guard, another one is a construction worker, two are in school, and the other one is still young.

Samnang has requested a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting once already. He wants to buy one more motorbike for his son who is a security guard to drive work, so he has decided to ask for another loan of $700.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his son who is a security guard to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase woods and varnish for her furniture shop business.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, the woman in the photo, is 32 and a chef. She cooks for a Christian NGO. Her husband, Savatdy, is 34 and a driver. They have been married since 1999 and have two daughters. One is in school; the other one is still young. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sina is requesting her first loan of US $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Nhing

texts.en: Nhing, 41 years old, is a sweet seller earning $6 per day. Her husband is a farmer and earns $1.50 per day. They have three children, all of whom are students. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $17 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to use when traveling to study. She doesn’t want to change her career selling sweets. She wants to support all of her children through university so that they can find a good job.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children traveling to study

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Raquel has a fruit stand that buys and sells different fruits, like durian. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to stock fruit to sell. Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to stock fruit to sell

loans.name: Marylie

texts.en: Marylie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Marylie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Marylie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marylie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Hajran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Hajran Bibi is 46 years old and married with six children: two daughters and four sons. Her daughters help Hajran in her sewing business, and her sons are in school: the eldest son reads in the 7th standard while the others read in 4th, 3rd and kindergarten. 

Hajran and her daughters have done sewing for many years. They receive orders from the neighboring customers and generate income for the family. They all also manage the household chores and take care of the family by fulfilling their needs. 

Hajran’s husband is involved in the business of selling chickens. He supplies chickens to different butcher shops and earns a good profit every month. He has been in this business for many years. 

Hajran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy chickens in a larger quantity to be able to complete the orders of his customers on time and earn maximum profits.

loans.use: to buy chickens for selling.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She sells a variety of merchandise such as cosmetics, shoes, wallets, perfumes, lotions, and clothing for kids, men, and women. She is thankful because her direct selling business is growing due to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in this line of business for two years, and earns about P 5,000 a month. 

Grace would like to continue improving her business, but because of some credits, she could not buy more products. For this reason, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P 25,000 to purchase more products needed by her customers. Grace is also thankful because her husband is supportive in raising their children, and is also supportive of the direct selling she manages. While she's busy in selling her products house-to-house, her husband wakes up early to manage his transport motorcycle business. The couple works hard to send their children into higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
